entries.title: Police foil attempts to smuggle 30kg of meth using 3D printers
entries.description: Two men have been charged in Taiwan for using 3D printers to smuggle large quantities of methamphetamine.

entries.title: Linux...on a tablet? It might just work
entries.description: The PineTab, sent the way of the dodo by pandemic manufacturing concerns, is getting a refresh.

entries.title: Apple is reportedly working on some super-powered new Pro monitors
entries.description: Apple is reportedly working on a sequel to its high-end Pro Display XDR monitor.

entries.title: Work PC sales have plummeted once again
entries.description: Canalys finds Western European PC shipment slump continues in traditionally robust commercial sector.

entries.title: Hundreds of Android apps found leaking API keys, putting users at risk
entries.description: Threat actors could use leaked APIs to send fraudulent emails to Android users, and exfiltrate mailing lists.

entries.title: Matter makes landfall on Amazon Echo as  support continues to grow
entries.description: Part of a first wave of support, you'll be able to control Matter-enabled devices via your bedside Echo speaker.

entries.title: Leading VPN targets Russian censorship in provocative billboard campaign
entries.description: The Hide.me campaign comes amid a growing number of suspicious deaths among those questioning the war in Ukraine

entries.title: The new Mac Pro could still be an M2-powered beast
entries.description: Delays and politicking around manufacturing have meant that a Mac Pro running on powerful Apple Silicon is taking a long time - and cost consumers heavily.

entries.title: One of the best Xbox Game Pass games is leaving at the end of the month
entries.description: Award-winning Outer Wilds is one of eight games set to leave Game Pass at the end of December.

entries.title: IBM: Why the next step in 5G is all about acceleration
entries.description: We speak to Andrew Coward, GM of Software Defined Networking at IBM, to find out his thoughts on the 5G future.

entries.title: The next generation of Microsoft Teams is officially here to try now
entries.description: Try out the new Microsoft Teams Premium now.

entries.title: Six Final Fantasy games are getting re-releases in time for the 35th anniversary
entries.description: Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster collects the first six games in the series, and there is a Collector’s Edition for you superfans.

entries.title: Google, Apple and Mozilla are teaming up to build a better web browser benchmark tool
entries.description: Google, Apple, and Mozilla combine to work on Speedometer 3 web browser benchmark.

entries.title: Malware defeated by Google rises from the ashes
entries.description: Glupteba is back with more Bitcoin addresses and more malware samples, but with the same goal.

entries.title: Hackers are now targeting food supplies in BEC scams, FBI warns
entries.description: Scammers are stealing entire food package deliveries and selling them on the black market.

entries.title: It looks like footage from the next Assassin's Creed game has leaked
entries.description: Beta footage of what appears to be Assassin’s Creed: Codename Jade has leaked.

entries.title: AMD attempts to defuse controversy around RDNA 3 GPUs and ‘broken’ feature
entries.description: It’s good to hear AMD address the matter of shader pre-fetch hardware, but clock speeds remain a worry, too.

entries.title: Restaurant CRM platform SevenRooms confirms data breach
entries.description: A sample of the company's data allegedly showing API keys and guest data was published on an underground forum.

entries.title: Python malware is using a devious new technique
entries.description: Hackers use new tricks to keep their payloads hidden, including adding anti-debugging code

entries.title: Twitter users have decided if Elon Musk should step down in a bizarre poll
entries.description: Twitter CEO Elon Musk enraged a lot of users into restricting how links are shared - a new poll could decide if he stays.

entries.title: Gmail launches a big security update, but you might not get it yet
entries.description: Beta is open now for Gmail end-to-end encryption, but only some Google Workspace users will be eligible.
